fields.description:
Review and update on-screen prompts and the documentation.

There are many instances I have found where a prompt directs the user to click on 'something' which isn't referenced correctly (position on screen, title of hyperlink) or even present at all in some instances.

For instance, when setting up a Service desk I am guided by on-screen instructions which are awesome, right up until "Got it? Now click *Resolve this issue* and add a comment to complete this request.".... there is no link to 'resolve this issue', only 2 other references to resolution on the screen and no further guide as to what is meant other than to add a comment and hope for the best.

I'd have added a screenshot but it states "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again" with no indication of how to acquire a token..!

Instances such as these aren't constructive when trying to promote the use of Jira among colleagues who face contradictions like this and simply give up using it as "it's too confusing".

Confusion is bad.

Any feedback leaning towards "Well, it's obvious, if you'd noted the comment in your assumed Jira training 5 months ago you'll have remembered that..." is also bad.

 

 

Best wishes.

 

A minor grievance but omnipresent.
fields.summary: Review and update documentation

fields.description:
h3. Accidental JSDCLOUD-6037 duplicate. Please close.
h3. -Problem Definition-

-Issues created from emails attach files such as marketing advertisment images or even text often included in singatures to an issue, which can clutter things for issue asignees in that they might not be able to filter out important attachments or will lose valuable time in manually deleting attached duplicate files from attachments. Additionally, administrators may want to restrict certain files from a source from being attached to new and existing issues.-
h3. -Suggested Solution-

-Implement a file and text filter on a global (JIRA administrators) and/or project level (Project administrators) to exclude selected attachments or text from email content for new issues or comments added to existing. Next to each file there could be an option to quickly exclude attached file names and size (in case a different file with the same name is attached). We could have a filters manager in which admins could remove previously selected files and allow to be included in issue attachments again (similar to lists for blocked users in IMs).-
h3. -Why this is important-

-Issues with multiple files not pertinent to request or problem description not only clutter the system but also can cause delays in ticket processing or asignee to miss important attachments in growing list of duplicate files.-

 -- 

!Screen Shot 2018-03-21 at 21.01.26.png!
fields.summary: Ignore unwanted images in attachments for issues created from emails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Issues created from emails attach files such as marketing advertisment images or even text often included in singatures to an issue, which can clutter things for issue asignees in that they might not be able to filter out important attachments or will lose valuable time in manually deleting attached duplicate files from attachments. Additionally, administrators may want to restrict certain files from a source from being attached to new and existing issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a file and text filter on a global (JIRA administrators) and/or project level (Project administrators) to exclude selected attachments or text from email content for new issues or comments added to existing. Next to each file there could be an option to quickly exclude attached file names and size (in case a different file with the same name is attached). We could have a filters manager in which admins could remove previously selected files and allow to be included in issue attachments again (similar to lists for blocked users in IMs).
h3. Why this is important

Issues with multiple files not pertinent to request or problem description not only clutter the system but also can cause delays in ticket processing or asignee to miss important attachments in growing list of duplicate files.

 

!Screen Shot 2018-03-21 at 21.01.26.png!
fields.summary: Ignore unwanted images in attachments for issues created from emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When looking at a JSD Report, values will not appear for current month. Instead values displayed will be for incorrect month (previous month)
 * Only occurs for Reports shown by: *Past year by month*
 * JSD Report Gadget will also display incorrect information

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into instance
 # Change timezone in User Profile to Jira default (GMT+00:00)
 # View JSD Report
 # Show: *Past year by month*
 # Compare results with CSV export on Report. If numbers do not match, you are impacted

h3. Expected Results
 * Correct values for correct months

h3. Actual Results
 * Report displays values from current month on previous month
 ** Example: Looking Feb 2018, the values will be for March 2018 but the text will say Feb 2018

 

Incorrect Values:
 !Incorrect.png|thumbnail! 
 Correct Values:
 !Correct.png|thumbnail! 
 Correct CSV Values:
 !Correct-CSV.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Does not occur for all users. Root cause of the issue is due to a Timezone configuration. Users with the correct timezone will see the right values, while user with a different timezone will see incorrect information

h3. Workaround

Option A:
 * Exporting Report via CSV will provide correct values

Option B:
 Adjusting timezone will fix the issue for most users
 # Log into instance
 # Profile (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa)
 # Preferences (Edit)
 # Timezone > choose a different timezone
 # Update
 # Reload Report
fields.summary: Reports Showing Incorrect Values when Selecting "Past Year by Month"

fields.description:
{panel:title=Response - 6 Jun 18}
Hi there, thank you for your feedback about the recent changes to the help center. 

Recently, we did some research to see where people succeed and struggle with the current help center. One finding was that people have difficulty navigating to the help they need, especially if they have access to more than one service desk.

To help people quickly navigate among service desks from any page, we added the search to the top right. This change is the first part of bigger improvements based on these user studies. Our goal is to make it easier for people to get the help they need, and thus make it easier for your team to deflect and triage requests. Some upcoming changes include:
 * easier navigation across service desks and request types.
 * a better experience for people who only have access to one portal. They'll get the full help center experience, including front-and-center search, instead of landing in a service desk.
 * better browsing for knowledge base articles, so your team doesn't have to worry as much about keywords and labels.

Thank you again for all the feedback. We'll use your comments to iterate on designs and make sure you and your help seekers have the best experience possible.  I will comment on this ticket soon with an in-depth preview of the upcoming improvements. 

Cheers, 
Vincent - Jira Service Desk team
{panel}
 

 

This feature request has been created in order to get feedback on the new Search experience on the Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Feedback on the new JSD Portal search experience / change to "My requests" menu having moved in the avatar dropdown

fields.description: The widget stores additional info into the request, but they are currently not indexed, thus one can't use JQL to find issues created by the widget.
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues created via JSD Widget with JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently if the *Then* action of a service desk rules create an issue in a project where the respective screen has more than one tab it requires the Linked Issues field to be mapped in one of the tabs, otherwise the issue will be created without any links to the original issue.

In resume:
* If you have only one tab on your screen and don't have the Linked Issues field mapped on it the automation will successfully create the link
* If you have more than one tab on your screen and none of the tabs has the Linked Issues field mapped the automation will fail to create the link between issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk project
# Create an automation rule that has the *Then* rule to create another issue in the same project linking to the matching issue
# Change your project screens to have more than one tab

h3. Expected Results

The link between issues should be created.

h3. Actual Results

The rule succeeds in creating the second issue but no link is presented.
 
h3. Notes

Having the *Linked Issues* field on your screen is not a pre-requisite for either showing or making links that's why this is considered a bug.

h3.Workaround

Add the Linked Issues field in any of the screen tabs.
fields.summary: Automation rules fail to create link between issues because of screen configuration

fields.description: At the Customers page, if there's anything typed in the search field, the page will prompt about unsaved changes to this field when you close the tab or click a link to navigate away.
fields.summary: Remove leave page pop-up from Customers page

fields.description: We have installed the Dutch translation for our Cloud Service Desk project, but we are not happy with some of the translated field labels. We would like to be able to modify it.
fields.summary: Override (some of) the Dutch translations in Jira Cloud Service Desk Customer Portal

fields.description:
The search mechanism has changed from a simple OBVIOUS search box in the center of the screen (LIKE GOOGLE) to a tiny little search icon that brings up a - COOL - but far less obvious search box.

Searching knowledgebase articles is a PRIMARY - NOT SECONDARY use case. It should be FRONT AND CENTER!
fields.summary: Bring back search tool to front and center in new JIRA Service Desk Portal interface

fields.description:
Currently if I set security to only accept emails from registered customers those not registered do not receive any email advising their request has been rejected.
I would like to be able to configure my JIRA, to do this.
fields.summary: Configure JIRA to Inform that User Can't Create Ticket by Email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, admin need to perform a manual way to migrate the customer to Atlassian Account by :-
# Go to Customer Profile
# Click *Migrate to Atlassian Account*

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a public rest api request to migrate the customer to Atlassian Account and without application access.

h3. Why this is important
 Easier to admin to update their customer

h3. Workaround 
Perform it manually.
fields.summary: Public REST API request to migrate customer to Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option to *Show* , "Past quarter/year by month" for JSD report.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add additionaly *Show* option with :-
* Past quarter by month
* Past year by month

h3. Why this is important
More options for admin to view the report.
fields.summary: Add "Past quarter / year by month" selection in JSD report

fields.description:
I wish to integrate the Service Desk form in our own homepage.

I don't think that iFrame is an option and the widget, with the question mark is not the optimal way either.
fields.summary: Integrate servicedesk form in own homepage

fields.description:
It would be great to include the Service Desk widget in the Service Desk Portal because a customer might be reading a help page article and there isn't an obvious way to reach out for help from that page.

Another suggestion would be to include a "contact support" option when a customer clicks 'No' on the "Is this article useful".
fields.summary: Add Service Desk widget to Portal

fields.description:
As a Service Desk Administrator, it would be nice if I could copy the organizations created in one Service Desk project, to another Service Desk project.

In some cases, there are a lot of organizations created in a single Service Desk project, and then if I want to use the same organizations in another project, I will have to add them by hand, one by one.

If the Admin was able to copy them to the other project, it would save some time.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk copy organizations to another Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When triggering a reset password email on the service desk portal page there's no verification for an existing account for that email and in the end, no email is sent at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project
# Access the portal page and try to login with a nonexisting customer
# Trigger a reset password for that email

h3. Expected Results

Service desk should warn the user that there's no existing customer account for that email and no email message will be sent.

h3. Actual Results

The success message is displayed but no email is sent:
  !email.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Contact your JIRA admin or a member of the service desk team and ask for them to create your customer account.
fields.summary: Service Desk portal prints a successful message when trying to recover the password for a nonexistent account

fields.description:
On May 25, 2018 the EU GDPR comes into effect. This will impact how we deal with personally identifyable information from our customers.

Please provide the ability to add text to the effect "by submitting this form you understand and agree that your PII will be used by COMPANY NAME" to the request submission form:

!Screen Shot 2018-03-16 at 2.17.37 pm.png!

Thank you,
Nick Muldoon
Product Manager, [Easy Agile|https://easyagile.com/]

 

cc/ [~bbaker]
fields.summary: Agent / add consent language to request submission form on widget

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to add comments on a parent issue based on actions done to subtasks. I would like to add comments with values such as:
* subtask creation date
* subtask update date
* subtask closed/done date
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to add comments on a parent issue based on actions done to subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple attachments are uploaded with the same name from the portal, whilst each individual image is saved to Jira itself, in the customer portal the customer see's duplicate attachments of the first image uploaded - after saving that is, the preview shows as intended. Also in the comments on the Jira side the same attachment repeats itself like in the portal. But if you go to the attachment field of the issue you can see the individual images. 

Presumably, because it looks for the image name, finds the first image with that name and re-uses the same image for each subsequent attachment. This is very confusing for customers who believe they uploaded the same image multiple times. This also makes it very difficult for the agent to know which attachments belong to which comment.

You notice this a lot when customers have to paste multiple screenshots into a ticket.

See attached screenshot from the portal. They are two separate images named 1.jpg but the customer see's a duplication of the first one.

h3. Environment
Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From the customer portal upload multiple images with the same name
# Notice the preview displays each individual image
# Add the attachments
# Now one attachment is repeatedly displayed for each image

h3. Expected Results

Customer should see each individual image saved on their ticket.

h3. Actual Results

Customer see's duplicates of the first image uploaded
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround

Saving the image first with a different name. Severly hampers users who paste a lot of screenshots.
fields.summary: Problem viewing uploaded images with the same name

fields.description: When Jira sends an email on the From field you can read "Jira User name" <generic email configured> and this is producing some confusion on our customers that tries to answer to our agent using the generic Jira email, but for us is preferable to configure it as "No-reply"<generic email configured> to avoid email answers.
fields.summary: Allow change the From on email sended

fields.description:
*Summary*

This issue occurs specifically for the Outlook 2016 desktop client. When a satisfaction survey is sent to the customer and the customer opens that email, there are a total of 5 stars for each rating. If you focus onany of this stars, the right hand side of star can't be clicked properly, when you click on it, it does not open a link and instead just highlights the star. The left side of the star an be easily click and generates a link as intended. 

 

*Environment*

Outlook 2016 Desktop Client 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # In a Service Desk Project, create an issue as a customer.  
 # Make sure the Satisfaction Setting in the Jira Service Desk is configured and turned on. 
 # Resolve that issue as an agent, this will generate the customer satisfaction survey
 # As a customer, open the Outlook 2016 client and access the notification with the satisfaction survey
 # Click on any one of the 5 stars to the "right side" of the star, you will notice it does not trigger a link generation and open the web page with the survey. 
 # !cantclick.png|width=605,height=288!
 # Click on any one of the 5 stars to the "left side" of the star, you will notice it does trigger a link generation and open the web page with the survey.  

  

 

*Expected Results*

Able to click on any part of the "star" to generate the survey link in the browser. 

 

*Actual Results*

Only able to be click on the left side of the "star" to generate the survey link in the browser, right side of the star is not responsive. 

*Workaround*

The only workaround would be to use the Web Application Outlook client as the star can be clicked on both sides without any issue.
fields.summary: Stars in Satisfaction Survey in Outlook 2016 Client Can't Be Clicked Properly

fields.description:
I cannot find Issue link feature which able to link card from Jira to page on Confluence. Please help. This feature is so crucial for my team

 

!https://atlassianblog.wpengine.com/wp-content/uploads/blog-600x-retina2x-1-1.png!
fields.summary: Issue link feature is diappear

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk customer that have text as their default outgoing email format are receiving the word "true" in the description of the issue via email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default outgoing email format to txt
# Create an issue that fires a notification to a user utilizing Service Desk

h3. Expected Results

Email should be:


   Summary: Testing
       Key: CSP-4
       URL: https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/browse/CSP-4
   Project: Customer Service Project
Issue Type: Support
  Reporter: xxxxx@gmxxxxxx.com
true


h3. Actual Results

   Summary: Testing
       Key: CSP-4
       URL: https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/browse/CSP-4
   Project: Customer Service Project
Issue Type: Support
  Reporter: xxxxx@gmxxxxxx.com
Issue details should be here not in full.
 
h3. Notes

So far I have only seen this in JIRA Service Desk, regular notifications in JIRA do not seem to be affected.

h3.Workaround

Change the default outgoing email format to HTML
fields.summary: Text format notifications from Service Desk do not include the full description, only the word 'true'.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing your request in the customer Portal the issues statuses are appearing with a default yellow color instead of their respective workflow color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project
# Create a ticket
# Check the my request page of the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results

The issues should be listed with their status having the same color as the designed in the workflow.

h3. Actual Results

All status appear with a default yellow color:
 !portal.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

Accessing the issue directly in the portal still shows the color as it should:
!i1.png|thumbnail!
!i2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Portal is showing statuses with a different color than their workflow color

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Table not rendering correctly in JSD document [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/advanced-searching-780868119.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Browse to document [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/advanced-searching-780868119.html].

h3. Expected Results
 * Table in the paragraph with the title "Reference" should be formatted dcorrectly.

h3. Actual Results
 * Paragraph with the title "Reference" hosts the table that has RHS column obstructed by what seems to be content of the first cell.

!2018-03-09_17-13-16.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Table not rendering correctly in JSD document

fields.description:
Currently, even though we set, for example, the default language to Portuguese, there are two options in the customer portal that still shows in English.
On the customer's profile, it still shows the "Language" as *Automatically detect browser setting* and the sentence "Update your account details through Atlassian account".
It would be great if the translation gets applied to all information in the portal.
fields.summary: Apply the default language to all options in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user wants the ability to add custom blocks under the search bar in both the Customer Portal view and Help Center view. At the current point for the "Help Center" , only *Popular* and *Trending* can be seen and the content is pre-defined whilst the "Customer Portal" has the list of request type fixated at the bottom of the search bar.
h3. Suggested Solution

User would like to have the ability to add custom blocks beneath the search bar such as most searched pages or any other custom block content that allows the user to customize the blocks to the user's need and requirement.
h3. Why this is important

The user wants full control of the help desk portal template that is being generated by the Atlassian system, to a certain extent,  giving the user a better ability at controlling the content that is being displayed would help to create a more customer-friendly environment and promote more content to the customers visiting the portal/help center.
fields.summary: Allow User to Edit the Blocks in the Help Center/Customer Portal to Display Custom Content

fields.description: I would like to stop JIRA Sevice Desk from adding customers to the participants field of an issue automatically when an email request includes additional customers in the CC or TO fields. I would prefer our agents add them manually. Please advise.
fields.summary: Stop Jira from adding participants automatically via Email

fields.description:
*Summary*

When the user is creating an Automation Rule and reaches the THEN condition, if the user chooses the "Create Issue" option and at the same time if the number of fields for that particular issue-type exceeds a certain number(18- 20 fields) or if there are many fields that require a lot of space like the "Description" field, the field goes out of bound and cannot be clicked on or scrolled to, in some cases only half of the field can be viewed. 

 

*Environment*

New Jira Look and Feel 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Make sure the issue-type has about more than 20 fields configured when clicking on the Create Issue or has a lot of fields which take up large spaces. 
 # Make sure you are in the new Jira look and feel, go to any Service Desk project Automation page > Click on Add Custom Rule
 # Set the WHEN and IF condition to anything, for the THEN condition set it to "Create Issue", you will get the following results.

  !automation01.png|width=631,height=308!
 !automation02.png|width=572,height=337!
 !automation03.png|width=606,height=339!

In this scenario, the second Approver field is stuck half-way and the fields below the second Approver field do not show as well even though they are configured in the field configuration. 

 

*Expected Results*

The "Create Issue" fields shows properly in the given space when scrolling down and filling up the fields. 

 

*Actual Results*

The "Create Issue" field goes out of bounds and some of the fields can't be seen or only show halfway. 

 

*Workaround*

The only workaround available at the moment is to use the old Jira look and feel where this issue does not persist.
fields.summary: Automation THEN Option: "Create Issue" Goes Out of Bounds With Large Number of Fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Can't load/download/view attachments in knowledge base from Service Desk portal when the attachment has a space in the name. Example of attachment name: *attachment 1.png*. The endpoint is redirecting back to Confluence with incorrect path, 
{noformat} 
/wiki/download/thumbnails/84082689/Attachment+1.PNG?version=1&modificationDate=1520507194166&cacheVersion=1&api=v2&width=515&height=250
{noformat}
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate a knowledge base to a service desk project.
# Create a page and upload an attachment that has a space in the file name.
# Load/Download/View the attachment from service desk portal.

h3. Expected Results
* User should be able to load/download/view the attachment from the portal.

h3. Actual Results
* Can't load/view the attachment, clicking on the attachment to download, it'll redirect to a page with 404 error.

h3. Workaround
* Remove *"api=v2"* onwards from the path. Example of path: 
{noformat} 
/wiki/download/thumbnails/84082689/Attachment+1.PNG?version=1&modificationDate=1520507194166&cacheVersion=1&api=v2&width=515&height=250
{noformat}. 
Remove {{&api=v2&width=515&height=250}} and enter the URL directly on a new tab to download the attachment.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base's attachments endpoint is not working properly in Service Desk when the attachment has a space in the file name

fields.description:
*Summary*

When the user accesses the Help Center via mobile phone, the margin of the Help Center header which is above the form search box is not aligned properly and it indented to the left. 

 

*Environment*

Android 
iOS

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Go to any Service Desk portal page via mobile phone > Click on the Help Center top left corner logo to redirect to the Help Center page. 

 

 

*Expected Results*

The Help Center screenshot via Desktop browser:  "Welcome to the Help Center" is aligned.

!desktop-browser.png|width=869,height=212!

*Actual Results*

Screenshot from Google Browser (Android) : "Welcome to the Help Center" is not aligned.

!android_screen.jpg|width=462,height=281!

Screenshot from Opera Browser (iOS) : "Welcome to the Help Center" is not aligned.

  !image-2018-03-08-17-49-39-696.png|width=209,height=372!
fields.summary: Mobile View of Help Center Heading is Not Aligned with Search Bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

SLAs that should've been active are not being displayed in service desk issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 new issues
# Close one of them
# Create new SLA which should be triggered by Issue creation event (and stop when issue is Closed)

h3. Expected Results

When accessing a service desk issue you should be able to see new SLA on both issues.

h3. Actual Results

SLA is displayed for not Closed issue
 
h3.Workaround
Executing the following KB normally fixes the problem:
 [^How to fix SLA using Postman.pdf] 

In case the issue persists please engage Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: SLA's not displaying in service desk issues for a new SLA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When set *text* as notification template from user profile or default user preferences setting , attachment link in customer notification will directed customer to id.atlassian.com instead of Customer Portal login page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *System > Default User Preferences*
# Set *Default outgoing email format* to *text*
# Then , create issue on behalf of customer (with no Atlassian Account)
# As an agent , add a comment with attachment.
# Customer receive the notification, then click the attachment link

h3. Expected Results
Customer will be directed to customer portal login page and download the attachmnet.

h3. Actual Results
Customer directed to id.atlassian.com. The customer doesn't have Atlassian Account, he/she shouldn't be directed to this page.
 

h3.Workaround
Set the Outgoing Email format to *html*
fields.summary: Attachment Link will directed customer to id.atlassian.com instead of Customer Portal login page when using Plain Text notification template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, customer portal form only can be set based on Request Type. It will be better if admin can have another layer of field configuration that is based on Organization.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have another option in Request Type field configuration. Allowing to set field based on Organization

h3. Why this is important
Allow admin to have a different form for each organization
h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Options to create list of field for Customer Portal form based on Organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Email fails to process on the Incoming Mail Handler when the attachment is over 10MB.
{quote}The incoming email size (14596668 bytes) exceeds the maximum allowed message size (10485760 bytes).
{quote}
You can setup a forward email to forward the error message onto another email but it still won't be processed as an issue Jira.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the issue to be created, ignoring the attachment if it's too large but add a warning message onto the issue saying it failed to upload an attachment.
h3. Why this is important

Some client's are left in the dark to whether they have successfully created an issue or not.
h3. Workaround

None Available
fields.summary: Create issue via Incoming Mail Handler regardless of attachment size

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Images in Knowledge Base (KB) articles / pages rendered in the Customer Portal are displayed cropped if they are too wide

h3.Environment

Customer Portal

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Create a page in Confluence and added an image with 1547px.
* Create a project 
* Linked pages to the KB Service Desk Project
* Visualize the page in the Customer Portal


Customer Portal
!Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 15.21.58.png|thumbnail! 

Confluence
!Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 15.22.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected Results

Jira Service Desk's customer portal should resize the image to fit in the page.

h3.Actual Results

Jira Service Desk's customer portal does not resize the image to fit in the page.

h3.Workaround

The image is only cropped beyond 600px wide. So if you reduce the size of your image width to 600px it will display correctly in the portal (note: lightbox feature to maximise the image fullscreen doesn't work in the portal either)
fields.summary: Images in Knowledge Base (KB) articles / pages rendered in the Customer Portal are displayed cropped if they are too wide

fields.description:
h3.Summary

No error message is shown if password doesn't match.

h3.Environment

Customer portal

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Add a customer to the project;
* Access the customer portal;
* Log in using the wrong password;
* No error message is shown.
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 12.09.54.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected Results

An error message saying that the password doesn't match.

h3.Actual Results

No error message is shown.

h3.Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: No error message is shown if password doesn't match

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no public API to retrieve email logs. Admin will not aware when email stop working unless they notice there's no issue created, or going to the email logs to check the logs. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a REST API to retrieve the logs.

h3. Why this is important
Admin will not aware when email stop working unless they notice there's no issue created, or going to the email logs to check the logs. So, when having the API they can retrieve the logs without login.
fields.summary: Public REST API for retrieve Email Connection/Processing Log

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an Issue Type that is associated with a Request Type is deleted, JIRA will fail at changing the default support language on that Service Desk Project


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new issue type. Let's call it "Travel"
# Go to the SD project and create a new Request Type, using "Travel"  as the Issue Type.
# Add at least 1 custom field to the Request Type.
# Go to JIRA Administration > Issue Types and delete the "Travel" Issue Type
# Back to the SD Project, try changing the default language for the project.

h3. Expected Results

The default language of the project is updated

h3. Actual Results

The following error pops up:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

JIRA logs show the following:

{noformat}Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: FD-86: Failed to copy translations of project 10004 from Lingo to original table: The request type you are trying to view does not exist. {noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Contact the Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Unable to change the default language of a project if a Issue Type is deleted.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When login to customer portal using existed username with a wrong password or using non existed user causing infinite loop at Login button
 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any customer portal
# Login using existed username with a wrong password or using non existed

h3. Expected Results
An error with wrong password or non existed user displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Infinite loop at login button :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-01 at 4.20.17 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Login to Customer Portal with not existed customer and using a wrong password causing infinite loop at Login button

fields.description:
h2. Description
When a customer email address is added to a JSD project, s/he is unable to login to the portal without his/her password being reset.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Add a customer email address to a JSD project
# Ask the customer to login via the portal page (note that the password doesn't exist, but no indication is given to the customer).

h2. Expected results
The portal page should display an error showing that the login credentials are incorrect.

h2. Actual results
The login progress icon is displayed with no sign of stopping (see screenshot below.)
 !2018-03-01_16-33-49.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Workaround
Reset the customer's password in User Administration and ask him/her to use the correct password.
fields.summary: Login page for customer portal doesn't show error for incorrect login credentials

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reports are using the user system timezone instead of the profile setting.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the computer time to a timezone other than the one set on Jira's profile
# Open s Service Desk report. E.g.: Created vs Resolved
#* If Jira's timezone is GMT+12 and the system timezone is GMT+3 then for a few issues resolved on March 1st will be listed on report as resolved on February 28th

h3. Expected Results
Report uses the timezone on user's profile

h3. Actual Results
The user system's timezone is considered while the report is being generated
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Set the same timezone for Jira and the computer
fields.summary: Reports are using the user system timezone instead of the profile setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers that are migrated to Atlassian account lose the access to the customer portal.
When a customer is created as a portal only customer, they have access to the portal, but once they are migrated (if they didn't have an Atlassian account) they can login but it says "You don't have access to any portals".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer in the project.
# Let the customer activate the account and access the portal.
# Make sure the same account does not already have an Atlassian account on Atlassian Cloud (Not just the Cloud site).
# After confirming that the customer can see the forms, go to the site administration and migrate the user to Atlassian account.
# Customer will receive an email to "Join them now" to finish the account creation.
# As the customer doesn't have any license, they will be redirected to the portal.

h3. Expected Results

As they don't have any license, they will be automatically redirected to the portal and will see the forms.

h3. Actual Results

They are redirected to the portal but it says "You don't have access to any portals".

h3. Notes

The issue only happens when the migrate to Atlassian account has to create a new Atlassian account when it doesn't exist yet.
 
h3.Workaround

When a customer is migrated, they are keeping with two accounts, but one is set as inactive.
Delete the customer account on Site Administration > Jira Service Desk > Portal only customers.

In case this doesn't solve the problem, please contact our [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Customers that are migrated to Atlassian account lose the access to the customer portal

fields.description: As an admin, I'd like to change/remove customer survey scores, as sometimes users misselect the proper answer.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to edit or remove CSAT responses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk Connectivity logs display dozens of "AUTHENTICATE failed" errors, just to successfully connect a minute later. While this does not prevent the mail handler from working, it still causes confusion to our customers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Custom Service Desk Email Handler
# Wait for a few hours
# Check the connectivity logs

h3. Expected Results

As long as the password isn't changed, you shouldn't see "AUTHENTICATE failed" errors.

h3. Actual Results

"AUTHENTICATE failed" errors are eventually displayed in the logs, followed by a "Success" entry.

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-28 at 10.56.04 AM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the JIRA Logs:
{noformat}
msg:	 [AUTHENTICATIONFAILED] Invalid credentials (Failure)	
    	 stack:	 javax.mail.AuthenticationFailedException: [AUTHENTICATIONFAILED] Invalid credentials (Failure)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Connectivity log displays "AUTHENTICATE failed" errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When click "Send me a test email" , return {{HTTP Status 429 - Too many requests}} error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any JIRA Service Desk project
# Open customer notification page.
# Click *Edit Template*
# Click *Send me a test email*

h3. Expected Results
Email successfully send.

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-28 at 7.53.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* It also happen to any customer notification rules template.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: "Send me a test email" from customer notification configuration return HTTP Status 429 - Too many requests error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you set a start hour to an SLA calendar for a day of the week that hour will not be available for the next day you want to set up.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new calendar 
# Set the business hours for a day of the week. Ex: Monday 8am - 5pm
# Set up the business hours for another day of the week

h3. Expected Results
All the hours must be available to the following day.

h3. Actual Results

The hour you have selected on the first day it will not be available for the other ones. For example, if you set Monday 8 AM. When you try to set up Tuesday it does not appear in the select box the option to select 8 AM. It will show 7 AM - 9 AM...


h3.Workaround
You can click on the save button and then edit the calendar, the 'hour' previously selected it will be available again.
fields.summary: SLA calendar does not allow us to set start hours for different days

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a JSD portal only customer with e-mail: [foo@example.com|mailto:foo@acme.com] (eg: via Customers page / raise request on behalf)
 # Create an Atlassian Account Jira user with the same e-mail [foo@example.com|mailto:foo@acme.com]
 # Raise a request via Widget

h2. Expected

Help seeker see confirmation message, confirmation e-mail and request is created in JSD
h2. Actual

Help seeker see confirmation message, but never get confirmation e-mail, request is not created in JSD
h2. Workaround

Consolidate all duplicate users into one. This can be achieved by migrating Portal only customers to Atlassian account. See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html
fields.summary: Can't create request via JSD Widget if there are duplicate user with same e-mail

fields.description:
The Jira Service Desk Configuration setting for Notifications seems to imply that it is possible to have Jira send notifications as configured per Notification Scheme to customers.

!image-2018-02-27-16-02-54-796.png!

I can't find any reference relating to a clear explanation about the effects of this setting. I expect customers to receive notification as configured by the notification scheme. This is however not the effect when I started testing this.

Another user already shared his experience (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5564).

Could anybody please refer me to documentation that explains the use case for this setting?
_nb the learn more link is broken on Cloud as well_
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Configuration setting for Notification is not clear

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Automation rules that have the create issue action can be associated to a deleted issue link type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue link type.
# Configure an Automation Rule to create an issue and link them using the new link type.
# Delete the link type.
# Create a new issue that matches your rule condition.

h3. Expected Results

The rule should be executed fine but a warming to the user should be triggered saying that the configured link doesn't exists anymore.

h3. Actual Results

Both issues are created but they don't have any link associating them.
The following should be logged on the backend of JIRA:
{noformat}
message:[Create issue action] Could not find issueLinkType with ID 10302	
{noformat}

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround

If you're aware of the issue link that was deleted update the rule action to use another link type.
If you're not sure what link type was deleted and what rule is referencing it contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Automation rules creating issues without defined issue links

fields.description:
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 22/Apr/2021}
Hello everyone,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. We evaluated this ticket and understand that this is something we need to improve on. However, we will not be able to prioritise this at the moment as there are other items in the short term roadmap which are higher priority. We will definitely get back to you once we pick this up in our short term roadmap.

Regards,
 Sushant Koshy, Product Manager, Jira Service Management
{panel}




h3. Problem Definition

There is no way to disable portal automatic responses. If an admin has disabled the notification *Customer-visible status changed* for instance, then no notification/response should be made in the portal when that status has changed.

h3. Suggested Solution
 # The portal should abide by the rules set under customer notifications
 # Ability to edit portal automatic response settings

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Disable portal automatic responses based on customer notifications settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when customer clicks *View Request* from their notification email , they will directed to Customer Portal and need to login in order to view the whole issue detail including comments.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
It will be better if the customer can view the issue without login to Customer Portal. Maybe the link already have a private view that only the private link shared to the notification recipient can view the issue details.

h3. Why this is important
It will be better accessed for the customer to view their issue. Anonymous customer normally just send email to JIRA Service Desk to create a ticket. But not creating their account when receive the invitation email.

h3. Workaround 
Customer need to create an account and view it from customer portal
fields.summary: Allow customer to view their issue detail without login to Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are not notified if issue priority is updated.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to be notified when the priority of their tickets are updated.
h3. Why this is important
It allows transparency for customers.
fields.summary: Allow notifying customers on priority changes

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently anonymous users can see the Page History – i.e. all the updates taken place on the page. We do not want to let anonymous users view the entire page history.

Please let us know any workaround for it.

Regards,

Mrunalini
fields.summary: Stop showing  Page History to Anonymous Users

fields.description:
Hi,

We have Help pages published for anonymous users to view. We want our anonymous users to be able to opt for *Watch* feature on a particular page like Release Notes so that they receive notifications whenever the page gets updated.

Regards,

Mrunalini
fields.summary: Allow  Anonymous Users to Watch Pages

fields.description:
Hello,

Me and my team use Jira/Jira Service Desk along with Intercom. We have always wanted to show our Intercom Chat blip on our Service Desk portal for our customers to use. Just for small questions anyways while large matters would have to be submitted through forms. 

Also, chats could also be added to help requests automatically as well which would be sent to the customers if they provide their email in the chat conversation.
fields.summary: Intercom Chat Blip

fields.description:
We need to have a flexibility for configuring 'Reply-to' for Jira Service Desk notifications.

*How it works now:*

JSD sets "Reply-to" as per configuration in "Email requests' of JSD project.
 JSD sets "From" as per configuration of Notification scheme email.

There could be situations where customer doesn't want to configure custom email for 'Email requests' (for example, security concern), however would still like to change "Reply-to" email for the project's notifications.

*Suggestion:*

Have option to change "Reply-to" email to match Notification scheme email ("From" email). In this case we make sure that we use _verified domain_ of the instance.

Feedback from customer:
{quote}

I do think it should be more restrictive - I was literally talking about radio-buttons with either 1 option (when there is no inbound channel, matching the From address) or 2 options (when there is an inbound channel AND From address).

I guess to be backward compatible in the 2 option case the default value is to take the inbound channel address.

I was also implying NOT storing the actual email address value, but rather storing the strategy to be used to get the value at the time of sending. In this case the fact that domain is verified - is already taken care of (by the logic that allows or disallows you to set the custom From address)
{quote}
fields.summary: Have option to change "Reply-to" email to another verified domain

fields.description: Currently the widget allow users to search for the right request types and knowledge base articles, however there is no way for the customer to actually browse through all the available request type to raise the request.
fields.summary: Browse request type functionality for JSD widget

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When creating and assigning an issue at the same time it can happen that an SLA does not start.

 

Note this behaviour is not deterministic and so probably very hard to reproduce.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a standard Service Desk project with standard Time to resolution SLA (Starts on issue create and stop on resolution)
 # Configure the project to auto assign issues to the project lead
 # Create a new ticket

h5. Expected behaviour

The SLA metric is started for the new created ticket.
h5. Actual result

The SLA metric is not started for the new created ticket

 
h4. Workaround

Create the ticket and then assign the ticket in a second step.
fields.summary: SLA does not start when creating and assigning an issue at the same time

fields.description:
As a service desk manager, I need the ability to quickly and easily create new service desks using existing standards. 
 * VALIDATE: A 'scheme' for Issue Queues can be created and applied to new service desk projects
 * VALIDATE: A 'scheme' for Request Types (including fields) can be created and applied to a new service desk project
 * VALIDATE: A 'scheme' for SLAs can be created and applied to a new service desk project. 
 * VALIDATE: A 'scheme' for Automations can be created and applied to a new service desk project. 

Background: I work for a technology consulting firm that uses Jira to manage client service desks. We create new desk for each client to run client support. Personally, I think the platform is pretty terrible for non-internal client facing service and have said so. The primary reason for this opinion is that the creation and management of Jira service desks are cumbersome. I can bring over some schemes to simplify the effort, but there's still so much manual work in creating new desks I ultimately think it's just not worth the rub. 

All of this to say, the implementation of multiple service desks for external clients may very well NOT be in the interests or purpose of the platform. In that case, we just need to find a better solution for our company.
fields.summary: More Schemes

fields.description: I am trying to set up a way to alert customers creating an issue with the urgency set to "critical" to tell them to call our Help Desk. I would like it to be a pop-up of sorts or something that would appear on their screen with an alert of some sort.
fields.summary: Create a pop-up notification for customers based on issue priority

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Setting a custom fields configuration to required makes it a required field under Request Types which is good. But when you make the field optional again from field configuration that is not updated in the Request Types field and is still required in the portal.
 
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create custom field, add to JSD project screens
 # Make custom field required from Field Configurations
 # Note that custom field is required under Request Types fields
 # Make custom field optional from field configuration
 # The custom field is still required under Request Type fields

h3. Expected Results
 * If making a field configuration as required updates the Request Types field to required, setting it to optional should also update the Request Type field to not required.

h3. Actual Results 
 * The field is left as required under the Request Type fields. So the user must make two changes to make the field optional. Once from field configurations and once from Request Type fields.
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

 * User must manually update the request type fields after making a required custom field optional again from its field configuration
fields.summary: Changing custom field config from 'required to 'optional' leaves the field required under Request Types

fields.description:
When a user tries to add a *Request participant* to a ticket for a new customer, they need to add the customer first to *Customers* option.

There should be an ability to add the customers directly under *Request Participants* option.
fields.summary: Allow users to add the customers directly under the Request participants

fields.description:
Requires details for the below:
o Jira Service Desk Cloud bound by Jira cloud security??
o Password Security Policies addressed in Jira Service Desk Cloud ??
Change of user passwords every XX days ??

Is it possible to have a call/meeting with SD team member?
fields.summary: JIRA SD CLOUD Security concerns

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is currently no way to store additional information about Organizations. It would be useful for organising all the organizations and to keep track of additional information of each organization.

h3. Suggestion
Allow the storage of additional information for organizations. This can be via properties, key value pair, or anything else. These should also be searchable via the Issue Navigator if possible
fields.summary: Ability to store information about Organizations

fields.description:
h2. Summary 
After I added first language to be used in my Service Desk project I wasn't able to add second one (couldn't find the way)

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create new project
# Add first language
# Try to add another one

h2. Expected result
There is a button to add New language 

h2. Actual results
There is not button to add New language

h2. Workaround
There is a button Add translation which seems does the thing (allow to add another language)
fields.summary: Cannot add second language for project translation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When having a validator of the type "field should not have more than one value" in the creation transition of your workflow when trying to create a ticket that breaks the validator through the service desk portal you will receive a general error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a service desk project with the following/or similar validator in the workflow:
{noformat}
Multi-select field Component/s should not have more than one value
{noformat}
# Create a request type through the portal violating that validator.

h3. Expected Results

The portal should display the same error of JIRA:
{noformat}
Component/s should not have more than one value.
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results

The portal display the following error:
{noformat}
Error

Your request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in.
{noformat}

Which doesn't give any clues about what is off.

h3. Notes

*This should be affecting multiple validators.*

h3.Workaround

Add the description of the request type field to advise the customers that the field has certain validators.
Remove the validators from the create transition.
fields.summary: Error handling problems of JIRA service desk portal around workflow validators

fields.description:
Hello,

is possible to create a form inside Service Desk or confluence a form to do some requests (for exemple virtual machines creation request, monitoring services creation request).

I'm not asking you if there are templates, i'm asking if there is way to create those forms and make it available for all users (or a group). This form should have customized fields.

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Creat Request FORM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- Unable to copy comments from *Create Linked Issue* as shown below
- !image-2018-02-17-02-38-50-166.png|width=483,height=352!

h3. Suggested Solution
- Ability to copy comments to linked issue

h3. Why this is important
- it's difficult internal development to switching JIRA again & again from one to another. If we are creating the linked issue, comments should be captured along with attachments.
fields.summary: Ability to copy comments in Create Linked Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing backup from instance A to instance B , the email request domain will not change to instance B.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export back up from instance A. Make sure the instance have JIRA Service Desk project.
# Then, import it to instance B.

h3. Expected Results
Email request domain will change to instance B domain.
h3. Actual Results
Email request domain still using the old domain name.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Turn off the email request and enable it back. JIRA Service Desk will automatically create a new email request using the new domain. However, it will deleted the custom email request. User need to reconfigure it back.
fields.summary: After performing import , Email Request domain will not change to the new instance domain

fields.description:
*Summary*

While creating Service Desk projects there are a total of three options to choose from ( IT Service Desk, Customer Service Desk or Basic Service Desk). As a customer, it would be great if the users are allowed to choose a template and build the Service Desk and at a certain point if needed to be able to change the default template to another choice that they feel suits better with their project. 

The versatility in this would be helpful in many cases, even when during accidental wrong template creation, corrections can be made easily.
fields.summary: Ability to change Jira Service Desk template after Project Creation

fields.description: The field *Email confirmation to* in the request creation screen for anonymous users could be simply called *Email Address*.
fields.summary: Change the Email field in the request creation for anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing and saving the system automation rule 'Update when a linked issue changes' breaks the text added to the issue when the linked issue is resolved (no link to issue and formatting is lost).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD project
# Create two issues TEST-1 and TEST-2
# Link one of the ticket as *caused by* the other ticket (e.g. TEST-1 is caused by TEST-2).
# Transition the TEST-2 to Resolved.
# Open TEST-1 one, see the right format of the comment having the link to TEST-2 at the top with the text below saying: "Please check this issue for more details"
 !before-editing-the-rule.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the automation rule (E.g. change the comment type from internal to public and save).
# Reopen TEST-2 and resolved it again.

h3. Expected Results
The right text with the link to TEST-2 is added to the comment in TEST-1

h3. Actual Results
Only the text: "Please check this issue for more details" is added to the comment in TEST-1
  !after-editing-the-rule.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
This will not happen when only editing *IF* condition.

h3.Workaround
Delete the existing *Update Jira linked issues* and add a new default *Update Jira linked issues* automation.
fields.summary: Editing the automation 'Update when a linked issue changes'  removes the link from the text and breaks the formatting

fields.description:
*Problem Description*

When "Add comment" text and put "@" system says there are no matching users, in a Automation.

*Steps to Reproduce* (when affected):

In the "then" part of the automation, type @ and start typing, it returns nothing.

*Expected behaviour:*
It should return the users with permissions to that project.

*Actual behaviour:*
It shows nothing.

*Workaround*

Use the "[~" and put this username directly.
fields.summary: When "Add comment" text and put "@" system says there are no matching users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Widget does not recognize accents when the default language is Portuguese.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add Portuguese as the default language.
# Create the widget.
# On the widget, search for a form where the request type has an accent.

h3. Expected Results

The link to the form appears for the customer to open a request.

h3. Actual Results

It only shows the default request type.
 
h3.Workaround

Add this to your page's {{<head>}}:{code}<meta charset="utf-8">{code}
fields.summary: Widget does not recognize accents when the default language is Portuguese

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the embedded widget it is not possible to add attachments when you submit a request.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow uploading an attachment through the widget when creating an issue.

h3. Workaround

After creating the issue via a widget you can view the customer request from the notification email you receive and add an attachment as per usual through the customer portal.
fields.summary: JSD Widget should allow adding attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a user already exists in User Management but is inactive/active tried to sign up for customer account via customer portal , it will throw error below :-
 !Bildschirmfoto 2018-02-13 um 16.02.42.png|thumbnail! 

Customer will not know the reason they received the error. Only Atlassian Support can investigate it and notice it was due to user is exist but inactive.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a user friendly error for inactive user, for example :-
{panel}
"User already exist but it is inactive. Kindly check with the User Management and active the user"
{panel}

Provide a user friendly error for active user, for example :-
{panel}
"You already have a Jira account. Please login with that account or have your administrator reset the account for you"
{panel}

h3. Why this is important
User will understand the reason customer couldn't created an account.
fields.summary: User friendly error when inactive/active user sign up for customer account from Customer Portal

fields.description: As an admin, I want to enable specific team member to make internal comments but limit their ability to make external comments.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to restrict specific team member to send external comments

fields.description: As an admin, I'd like to have the ability to implement an approval process for external comments for JSD agents. This is needed to make sure that comments that go out externally to clients have been reviewed and approved.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to set an approval process for external comments for JSD agents

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Accessing customer portal via mobile, the knowledge based suggestion will overlapping the form field.
h3. Environment
Any mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access customer portal via phone
# Click any request type to create issue.
# Key in Summary that will suggest a KB

h3. Expected Results
The listed KB will be listed below the field form.

h3. Actual Results
The KB is overlapping the field form.
 !image2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Knowledge based suggestion is overlapping form field when accessing Customer Portal using Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Widget is not working smoothly in iOS 11.2.5. When a clicking the widget icon, the widget is not open immediatly. On top of that, the cursor is not pointing inside the field. 

h3. Environment
* iOS 11.2.5
* Safari or Chrome browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a widget in any website.
# Then, open the widget using iPhone with iOS 11.2.5.
# Try clicking the icon to open the widget and clicking the field.

h3. Expected Results
Widget working smoothly.

h3. Actual Results
Here I attached a video :-
 [^Video.MOV] 
 
h3. Notes
It didn't happening in older version of iOS and to Andriod phone.

h3.Workaround
Use Android phone or older version of iOS.
fields.summary: Widget is not consistently responsive when using in iOS 11.2.5

fields.description:
Possibility of performing a bulk update in the customers' profile information.

Could be something similar to the procedure mentioned here (copy information from CSV): [Bulk add customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-bulk-add-customers].
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update customers
Jonas test issue

fields.description: While I think the whole left side menu is very confusing in the new Jira design, access to detailed searching is the worst. It's very convoluted and requires numerous clicks. I'm not sure how to even access the JQL search function directly. Either I have to click a pre-populated search option that I don't want and adjust the query, or I have to view all issues then type in a search query.
fields.summary: New JIRA Design: Improve access to JQL / Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user clicks on a Related article within the Service Desk KB view, a new tab is opened. If we click on the same link within Confluence view then it opens the link in the same tab.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Service Desk KB article.
# Click on a related article, it opens in a new tab.

h3. Expected Results
Should it show as a new tab or on the same tab?

h3. Actual Results
Links open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Service Desk KB articles open in a New tab. Feature or Bug?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If no other field is filled during the issue creation, the "Created at" will not appear for customers under the View Request page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log as a Service Desk Customer
# Create a Requests, filling only the "Summary" field. (Make sure that no other field is required)

h3. Expected Results

By checking the requests, the "Details Section" should show at least the "Created date".

h3. Actual Results

The Details section is completely blank.
fields.summary: Created date won't appear if no other field is visible - customer portal

fields.description:
As a customer, I would like to have the ability to take a screenshot through the widget.
Also, it would be great if the screenshot gets automatically added to the form.
fields.summary: Screenshot through Widget

fields.description:
*Summary*

When using the Service Desk as a link integrated to an external website or linking the Service Desk via the widget, there is no possible way to customize the logo URL or to have a "Back to Main page" button located in the Customer Portal, the users who visit this external page have a disconnected experience when clicking on the "Support Center" link which leaves them with no options to redirect themselves to the external website. Clicking on the logo will loop the users only in the Support Center links.

It would be great if there is a "Back to Main page" button that can be configured or if the top left logo in the Jira Service Desk Customer Portal can be configured to change the URL for a smoother transition and customer experience. 

*Workaround*

The only possible thing to do now, is to click on the *Back* button of the browser to return back to the original page.
fields.summary: Ability to Customize Logo URL on Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a knowledge based article have a long title name, it will not disply full in widget
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a KB with a long title name , for example "How to make sure I use Confluence with the best method and How to use JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Based"
 # Then, open the KB from widget 

h3. Expected Results

The title will display full .
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2018-02-12 at 4.05.37 PM.png!
fields.summary: Widget will not display full title of Knowledge Based article

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Page Tree macro won't load for portal only users when accessing a KB article from JSD customer portal (KB viewer page + dialog)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project and Link to a Confluence space
 # On Confluence, configure the following page structure:
{panel:title=Confluence page structure}
 * Page 1
 ** Page 1.1
 *** Page 1.1.1
 **** Page 1.1.1.1
 **** Page 1.1.1.2
 **** Page 1.1.1.3
 **** Page 1.1.1.4
 *** Page 1.2
 **** Page 1.2.1
 ***** Page 1.2.1.1
 ***** Page 1.2.1.2
 ***** Page 1.2.1.3
 ***** Page 1.2.1.4
 * Page 2
 * How-to Articles{panel}

 # On page 2, configure a Page Tree Macro with *Page 1* as _Root Page_
 # Open page 2 as a customer on customer portal

h3. Expected Results
 * Load page tree macro and show the full tree of _Page 1_.

h3. Actual Results
 * Page tree macro does not load;
 * The below error is thrown in the browser console (tested Chrome and Firefox)
{noformat}
Mixed Content: The page at 'https://gattino.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/1736825?applicationId=255b83af-5e0d-3e1d-a9a4-428a9150f371&title=How+to+add+a+page+tree+macro%3F&spaceKey=CS&q=how+to+add&q_time=1518194091684&portalId=1' was loaded over HTTPS, but requested an insecure XMLHttpRequest endpoint 'http://gattino.atlassian.net/login?dest-url=/wiki%2Fplugins%2Fpagetree%2Fnaturalchildren.action%3Fdecorator%3Dnone%26excerpt%3Dfalse%26sort%3Dposition%26reverse%3Dfalse%26disableLinks%3Dfalse%26expandCurrent%3Dfalse%26hasRoot%3Dtrue%26pageId%3D1704024%26treeId%3D0%26startDepth%3D0%26mobile%3Dfalse%26ancestors%3D1605879%26treePageId%3D1736825'. This request has been blocked; the content must be served over HTTPS.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 * Edit the Confluence page and replace the Page Tree macro with a *Children Display macro*, setting the Parent Page to be the root page of the page tree you want to display.
fields.summary: Page Tree macro won't load for portal only users in the customer portal KB viewer page + dialog

fields.description:
*Summary*

As of now, the Jira Service Desk comes bundled with Jira Core, even if Jira Core has basic board functionality, Jira Service Desk cannot link to Jira Core board at the current stage but this can be done with Jira Software and Jira Service Desk. 

It would be great that Jira Service Desk issues can be collected and viewed via the Jira Core board functionality as it ships together and thus would help with management and utilizing the Jira Core feature to the best.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Core boards to be linked with Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
*Summary*
Within the Jira Service Desk environment there are at least two emails that can be configured, when navigating from the system dashboard page > Projects->View all Projects->All project types - All categories screen, you are able to view the URL for all the projects listed, it would be great if the *Email Requests* emails data are collected and put into a column here for the reference of the agents. 

Especially in a business environment, whereby the customers specify which emails that they have sent the request to and it'd be easier to track down via the Projects page if there is a column that collects that information. With more than 30 Service Desk projects it might be cumbersome to go through each and every one project to find what project is being referred to.
fields.summary: Show Project Email in the All Project Category Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When some JSD issues have Issue types that don't have a valid request type or change the request type of an issue to an Issue type to doesn't have an equivalent service desk request type. Notifications stop going to the reporter when ticket updated. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or add a new issue type in the JSD project, eg BUG.
# Create a JSD ticket.
# Change the issue type to Bug.
# Notice having the request type to be invalid.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
When updating the ticket, notification goes the reporter.

h3. Actual Results
No notifications 

h3.Workaround
Create a request type for each Issue type.
fields.summary: Notifications not sent to reporter when Invalid Request type with valid issue type

fields.description:
Currently implementing Organizations, and we would like the customers to see historic requests. This requires an organisation to be set in each request. Bulk Change is the perfect tool, but does not have the option to change the Organization. I have used the browser "find" and search for "org" and got no results on the page

Please add this option to assist customers implement Organizations.

The impact is either customers can not see historic requests or an agent has to manually edit individual requests.
fields.summary: Bulk Change issues - Can not add an Organization.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you try to validate a *Date Time Picker*'s value from a portal request in the workflow (e.g. value must be <= now) it will generate conflicts with the user raising a request if the time zone in the computer is different from the default one in the instance.

The validator in the workflow will use the *now* value as the instance's date/time, but when you enter the portal to raise a request the *Date Time Picker* will get the value from your computer configuration (If you set a default value in the field configuration using the current date/time feature, it will show you the instance's current date and time. But once you go to the portal, the default value will be converted to your computer's date and time).

 
h3. Solution
If somehow the *Date Time Picker* field would convert the date value inserted into the instance's value in order to do the comparison in the validator, it would avoid the conflict.
fields.summary: Date Time Picker should convert the value input into the instance's timezone

fields.description: I, as JIRA Admin, would like to have the feature to add the customer's name in the subject of the notification emails.
fields.summary: Add Customer Name to Subject of Email Notifications

fields.description:
The ability to change the Y axis in Service DESK SLA reports to hours instead of days in weekly reports is requested.

Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Change Y Axis in SLA reports from Days to Hours in weekly report

fields.description:
I want to use the new JSD Widget on my website's pages. In order to do that, I need to enable the login-free portal functionality as instructed [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal-for-jira-service-desk-cloud?_ga=2.119024969.1968941198.1517926249-279632604.1506395484]

If I do this, i no longer have the ability to capture the reporter when a customer uses the JSD Portal to log a ticket. I need to know the reporter so that I can match the newly created request with others that the customer has created. 

This is currently stopping me from implementing the JSD Widget on my website's pages.
fields.summary: Capture Reporter using Login-Free Portal
